text: Philip Vernon le Geyt Falle (19 March 1885 – 2 January 1936) was a Jersey sailor who represented Great Britain at the 1928 Summer Olympics in Amsterdam, Netherlands. He was born in British India and grew up in Saint Helier, Jersey. He was educated at Reading School in Berkshire. During World War I, he served in the Army Service Corps and was awarded the Distinguished Service Order in the 1916 Birthday Honours. ==References== Category:British male sailors (sport) Category:Sailors at the 1928 Summer Olympics – 8 Metre Category:Olympic sailors of Great Britain Category:1885 births Category:1936 deaths Category:People from Saint Helier Category:Companions of the Distinguished Service Order Category:Jersey male sailors (sport) Category:Jersey military personnel
title: Philip Falle (sailor)
